oneWireWeather
Class WeatherStation

java.lang.Object
  oneWireWeather.WeatherStation

public class WeatherStation
extends java.lang.Object

WeatherStation is the main class of the one-wire weather station. It provides the interface that allows a client to retrieve the weather data and to administer the weather server processes and configuration.

Version:
%I%, %G%
Author:
Seth Cohen

Constructor Detail

WeatherStation

public WeatherStation()
Create an instance of the WeatherStation. This constructor will also load the configuration indicating the sensors and settings for this weather station. It will also create/open a log file and saved statistics file and set them up to receive weather station events.

Method Detail

startWeatherStation

public void startWeatherStation()
Start the weather station process in a separate thread. This process will poll the sensor hardware based on the station configuration settings and notify this class after each reading by calling the receiveMessage() method.

getData

public WeatherData getData()
Retrieve the most recent readings from the weather station data acquisition thread.

Returns:
The most recent sensor readings as a WeatherData class.

getStatistics

public WeatherStatistics getStatistics()
Retrieve the statistics that have been collected for this weather station. These statistics include the minimum and maximum values for the common sensors. They also include averages and trends where applicable.

Returns:
The weather station stistics as a WeatherStatistics class

receiveMessage

public void receiveMessage(WeatherData data)
This method is called by the data acquisition thread whenever it has completed polling the conbfigured sensors.

Parameters:
data - A WeatherData class that holds the values from the sensors that were just polled. If any sensors were not polled this pass, the WeatherData contains the most recently polled values from that sensor.

getStationConfiguration

public StationConfiguration getStationConfiguration()
Retrieve the configuration for this instance of the WeatherStation. This includes the configured sensors, the 1-wire adapter, and the polling intervals.

Returns:
The configuration as a StationConfiguration class instance.

saveConfiguration

public boolean saveConfiguration(StationConfiguration config)
This method is used by clients to set a new configuration for this weather station. The new configuration will be saved to the disk file specified in the variable m_strConfigFileName. Before setting the new configuration, the weather station must be stopped and restarted. Also, any ConfigurationChangeListeners must be notified of the configuration change.

Parameters:
config - The new station configuration.
Returns:
true if the save to disk was successful

stopWeatherStation

public void stopWeatherStation()
Stop the data acquisition thread of the weather station.

addWeatherDataListener

public void addWeatherDataListener(WeatherDataListener listener)
Add an observer to listen for any weather data changes.

Parameters:
listener - a class that implements WeatherDataListener that wants to be informed of any changes in the weather data.

removeWeatherDataListener

public void removeWeatherDataListener(WeatherDataListener listener)

addConfigurationChangeListener

public void addConfigurationChangeListener(ConfigurationChangeListener listener)
Add an observer to listen for any weather data changes.

Parameters:
listener - a class that implements ConfigurationDataListener that wants to be informed of any changes in the weather station configuration.

getLog

public StationLog getLog()
Retrieve the log file from this weather station. The log contains all of the saved sensor readings. The number of readings is based on the configuration setting LogFileSize.

Returns:
The stationlog as a StationLog class.

getSensorTypeForUsage

public static SensorType getSensorTypeForUsage(int usage)
For a given sensor usage type, return the corresponding SensorType class.

Parameters:
usage - The sensor usage type to be looked up.
Returns:
The associated SensorType for the specified sensor usage.

addServerThread

public void addServerThread(oneWireWeather.WeatherServerHandler thread)

removeServerThread

public void removeServerThread(oneWireWeather.WeatherServerHandler thread)
